docs.lead_paragraph: STARTLING EXPOSURE OF THE MILK TRADE OF NEW-YORK AND BROOKLYN. Are you aware what kind of milk you are drinking? Are you aware that over seven thousand children die every year in New-York and Brooklyn from drinking swill milk?

headline.main: INTERESTING FROM EUROPE.; NEWS BY THE ARIEL.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Ariel, from Southampton on the afternoon of tile 21st ult, arrived at this port yesterday afternoon. We receive, by the Ariel, London papers of the 21st of April, and obtain from them some additional intelligence of interest. The Acquittal of Simon Bernard. We have already published a full abstract of the trial of Dr. BERNARD, in London, for complicity in the Orsini murders of the 14th of January last.
docs.abstract: Desires Br. Gov. to annex Sarawak

headline.main: BROOKLYN ITEMS.; The New Board of Aldermen--A Democratic Majority--Election of Officers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Wm. Lloyd Garrison wrote a letter to the Orsini sympatbisers in Boston last week. In it he held the following language: Your meeting will receive no sanction from the American press, people, or Government. How can America sympathise with any struggle for freedom in the Old World ? She holds every seventh person of her vast population in fetters of iron, as a brute beast, as an article of merchandise.

docs.lead_paragraph: The screw steamship Anglo-Saxon, from Liverpool on the 21st ult., passed Riviere du Loup on her way to Quebec yesterday afternoon, and her news is telegraphed to us from that point. The most interesting intelligence by this arrival is of a financial character.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. THOMPSON, the Health Officer of the port, with a party of gentlemen interested in Quarantine affairs, made an excursion to the lower bay on Saturday, visiting the various localities which have been indicated as suitable sites for Hospital and Quarantine purposes. The party, including several ladies and unprofessional persons, went on board the steamboat May Flower at 11 o'clock, With the band formerly attached to the frigate Susquehanna.
docs.abstract: The Expedition of Dr Thompson and his friends

headline.main: Quarantine and Sanitary Convention at Baltimore.

docs.lead_paragraph: The second annual meeting of the National Quarantine and Sanitary Convention opened in Baltimore on Thursday, and closed on Saturday. The address of welcome was delivered by Dr. KEMP, of Baltimore. The following officers were elected: President.--Dr. WM. M. KEMP, of Baltimore. Vice-Presidents.--Dr. John M. Moriarty, of Boston; George N. Eaton, Esq., of Baltimore; Dr. P. C. Gaillard, of Charleston, N. C.

headline.main: UTAH AND THE MORMONS.; Detailed Account of the Experiences of Frederick Loba. Interesting Personal Narrative---Loba's History---His Escape from Salt Lake City---Important Statements.

docs.lead_paragraph: Since sending you a brief notice of the case of Mr. LOBA, the escaped Mormon High Priest-together with a summary of his views as to the resources of the people of Salt Lake Valley, and of their ability to effectively resist the United States troops-I have received from him a detailed narrative of his connection with the Church of "Latter-Day Saints," which I am sure will be found highly interesting.

headline.main: MASSACHUSETTS.; Politicians Counting their Chickens--Theatricals-Sympathy with Orsini & Co.--Cars for Egypt-Removal of the Boston Library--Mortality in Boston-Prospects for May Day, &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The custom of counting chickens ere the eggs from which they are to be hatched have been laid, is a common one in this city, where people are supposed to take life hard and be of an ultra practical character. Our politicians are great "architects of ruin."
